snippet.title: Why I Need to Slow Down
Make a Noticeable Change With Fabric
snippet.description: How Fabric Can Add Color and Drama To Your Interiors

snippet.title: Mickey Tote Bag
snippet.description: Using colorful printed fabrics, kids can cover a plain canvas tote bag with a striking Mickey Mouse mosaic.

snippet.title: French Country Fabrics
snippet.description: How To Use Fabrics to Create a French Feel

snippet.title: Merida Doll
snippet.description: Here's how you and your child can transform a swatch of fabric and some bright bulky yarn into a doll that resembles the adventurous young archer.

snippet.title: Easy Halloween Costumes For Babies
snippet.description: Children look so cute dressed as fuzzy and furry creatures. Especially with whiskers painted on their chubby little cheeks!

snippet.title: UP Finger Puppet Crafts
snippet.description: Gather your friends and put on a puppet show featuring Carl, Russell, and the rest of the UP characters -- the sky is the limit!

snippet.title: Fringe Benefits
snippet.description: While your child is getting ready for school this fall, you can help her turn last year's too-short jeans into spiffed-up capris with some interchangeable decorative trim.

snippet.title: Friendly Giraffe Costume
snippet.description: A friendly giraffe made with no sewing that can also be used as PJ's when Halloween is over.
